Interactions.Line: So much to do, so little time… Take your time. Don’t be afraid. The door is still shut. Now, step forward. Can you do it? Power sleeps within you. If you give it form… It will give you strength. Choose well.
The power of the warrior. Invincible courage. A sword of terrible destruction. Is this the power you seek? / You give up this power?
Yes. / No.
Your path is set. Now, what will you give up in exchange?
The power of the mystic. Inner strength. A staff of wonder and ruin. Is this the power you seek? / You give up this power?
Yes. / No.
Your path is set. Now, what will you give up in exchange?
The power of the guardian. Kindness to aid friends. A shield to repel all. Is this the power you seek? / You give up this power?
Yes. / No.
Your path is set. Now, what will you give up in exchange?
You’ve chosen the power of the warrior/mystic/guardian. You’ve given up the power of the guardian/mystic/warrior. Is this the form you choose?
Yes. / Maybe not.
You’ve gained the power to fight. All right! You’ve got it. Use this power to protect yourself and others. There will be times you have to fight. Keep your light burning strong. Behind you!

Interactions.Title: Dive to the Heart - Awakened Princesses Platform

Interactions.Line: I can’t open it…
Hold on. The door won’t open just yet. First, tell me more about yourself.
What’s most important to you?
Being number one.
Is being number one such a big deal?
What are you so afraid of?
Getting old.
Gettin’ old? Is that really so scary?
What do you want outta life?
To see rare sights.
To see rare sights, huh?
You want to be number one. You’re afraid of getting old. You want to see rare sights. Your adventure begins at dawn. As long as the sun is shining, your journey should be a pleasant one.
Sounds good.
The day you open the door is both far off and very near.
Hold on. The door won’t open just yet. First, tell me more about yourself.
What’s most important to you?
Friendship.
Is friendship such a big deal?
What are you so afraid of?
Being different.
Being different? Is that really so scary?
What do you want outta life?
To broaden my horizons.
To broaden your horizons, huh?
You want friendship. You’re afraid of being different. You want to broaden your horizons. Your adventure begins at midday. Keep a steady pace and you’ll come through fine.
On second thought…
Okay, tell me again about the real you.
Hold on. The door won’t open just yet. First, tell me more about yourself.
What’s most important to you?
My prize possessions.
Are possessions such a big deal?
What are you so afraid of?
Being indecisive.
Being indecisive? Is that really so scary?
What do you want outta life?
To be strong.
To be strong, huh?

You like to collect neat things. You’re afraid of being indecisive. You want to be strong. Your adventure begins in the dead of night. Your road won’t be easy, but a rising sun awaits your journey’s end.
On second thought…
Okay, tell me again about the real you.
So, can you gather the rest of the supplies? Sora, are you listening to me?
Yeah, I heard you. / What was that, again?
Okay, here’s what you need to go find
Two Logs. One Cloth. One Rope. Bring everything back here. If you need help, just ask. I’m counting on you! / No more slacking, okay?
How’d it go? Did you find everything?
It’s all under control.

It took forever, but our raft is almost finished! / Hey, what should we name our raft? We have to name it something! After all, we made it ourselves, with our own hands. / Sure is a pretty day! Good thing we finished before hurricane season.
I’m a little lost.

Hmm… Okay, here’s a hint. I think I saw some Cloth hanging somewhere. / I remember seeing some Rope somewhere beyond the dock. / Hmm… Have you covered the whole island? You’ll find Logs scattered on the ground.
I’m totally clueless.

You’re hopeless! Okay, let me break it down for you. See the lookout platform beyond the dock? I think I saw some Rope there, left over from when it was built. / You’ll probably find a Log washed up along the shore. There might be some on the little island, too. / You know the room at the top of the great tree? There’s a big Cloth hanging on the wall in there.
Hey, that was quick! Thanks, Sora. Let’s see, what’s still missing?
Well, that’s everything. Great job, Sora! / Wow, you’ve found everything already? Thanks, Sora! I found something today, too. Here, it’s yours.
Tired? Want to call it a day?
Not yet! / Yeah, let’s go home.
Okay, just let me know when you’re ready to head back. / Okay. It is getting late. We’ll finish up tomorrow.
Hey, Sora. Feelin’ up to a little competition?
You asked for it! / Let’s go one-on-one! / Sorry, not now. / I’m kinda busy now.
Alright, let’s go! / Hey, no problem. I can take you down myself.
You’re goin’ down!
Aw, man! I’m really off today. / You really think you can beat me?

You serious? Come on, be a man! / Why would you want to cross the ocean? Sword fights beat that any day! / Wakka and I are working on a new game. Everyone fights for the ball underwater. Let’s all try it sometime. / ‘Course, you and Riku will never be star players like me. / So what’s the score now? Ah, who cares?
Yo! You up for a round?
Sure, let’s play. / Hey! What’s up?
Play is for kids. This is serious!
Show me your stuff!
Aw, man. That really hurt! / I win!

Selphie thinks she’s in charge around here. It’s a drag. / Riku’s good at pretty much everything. Even you’re no match for him. / It’s so great, just hanging out around here. No parents to bug us…  / What’re you guys up to, anyway? Whatever it is, be careful. Of course, having Riku along should be a big help. / Take it easy. I get tired watching you run around! Then again, Tidus is just as bad, ya? Leave everything to Riku. He’ll take care of things.
What’re you up to these days? We never see you.
Wanna duel? / We’ve been busy.
All right! Now you’re talking.
Okay, don’t hold back!
Oh, I can’t believe I lost! / Better luck next time!

Riku and Kairi sure are busy these days… I should send Tidus and Wakka to check up on you guys. / We can come here on our own now. I’m all grown up. / Come on, tell me what you’re planning. Actually, never mind. I’ll find out on my own. / Tidus hasn’t noticed anything. He’s clueless!
Another round, Sora!
You three against me!
Okay, you asked for it!
Let’s get him!
I can’t believe we lost! / Hey, you guys! I think we overdid it. / Man, you’re unreal! / Not your day, I guess!
Did you get everything we need for the raft? I gave my stuff to Kairi. Hey, Sora, how about a quick round? Grab your sword.
Okay, you’re on! / Sorry, no time now.
This one decides the champion! / Okay. Some other time.
Ready or not!
Now the score’s 1 to 0! / Man, now the score’s 0 to 1!
Sora, you wanna go a few rounds?
You bet! / Sorry, I’m in a hurry.
All right! Let’s get started!
Aw, man! What’s up? / No contest!
Aw, don’t be a chicken! / This island is paradise without any adults to order us around. / Say, are you and Riku really pals? It’s hard to tell sometimes.
Hey, Sora! You could use some coaching, ya?
Want to go a round? / That would be great!
Nah, I can’t… Can’t resist, that is!
You’ve been training a lot, ya? / Wha-ho, yeah!

Now, want to learn a special technique? To hit a moving target, you gotta lock on. Lock on and you won’t lose track of it. / You can move boulders if  you push ‘em hard enough. / You know about the secret place, right? At the base of that tree? Who found that place, anyway? / Tidus and I swam out really far last time… There was nothing in sight but water, water everywhere. / Whatever you guys are up to, don’t do anything stupid, ya? / Man, I’m hungry! Let’s go home and get something to eat, ya?
What’s the matter, Sora? Something on your mind?
Let’s go a round. / It’s nothing.
Okay, but no whining when I beat you!
You got lucky! / What?! That’s all ya got?!

I wonder who I should share a paopu with…  / Riku’s always staring out to sea these days. Sometimes even shouting won’t get his attention. / You’re helping Kairi with something, right? What are you guys up to? / If you don’t share a paopu with Kairi soon, Riku might beat you to it. / Paopu fruit is precious, so don’t pick it unless you’re gonna share it! / Have you heard about the power of the paopu fruit?
Yeah. / What’s that?
Me? Well, I think I can do better than Tidus or Wakka! / If two people share the paopu fruit… their destinies become intertwined. Isn’t that romantic?
Hey, Sora. Our raft still needs a name. Let’s see… How about Highwind? What would you call it?
Me? Well… hmm… Excalibur!
Hey, how ‘bout…
The usual?
Let’s do it!
You guys at it again? All right, I’ll be the judge. The usual rules apply
Now the score’s 1 to 0! / Man, now the score’s 0 to 1!
Man, lighten up. It’s just a name, after all. / All right, we’re naming the raft Highwind.
What’s that? Oh, the paopu thing? It was just a joke. You should have seen your face. How ‘bout another lap around the course?
Okay, it’s a race! / I’ll pass.
I’m gonna leave you in the dust. / Are you upset or something? It was only a joke.
The raft’s almost ready! All we have to do now is load it with food. Hey, have you seen Riku?

Today we collect provisions for our trip! Let’s see. Sora, you’re looking for… One Seagull Egg. Three Mushrooms. Two Coconuts. Three Fish. And fill this up with Drinking Water. But not from the ocean! Bring everything back here. If you need help, just ask. Well, did you find everything?
It’s all under control.

Highwind/Excalibur… that’s a cool name. Sounds good to me! / Since Riku named the raft, is he the captain? / Excalibur… That sounds familiar. Where have I heard it before? / Since you named the raft, are you the captain? Then from now on, I’ll say, “Aye, aye, Captain Sora!”
I’m a little lost.

Hmm… Okay, here’s a hint. Seagulls lay their Eggs in coco palms. Thanks, Captain Sora! / Coconuts are growing on trees all over the island. Ever tried coconut milk? It’s tasty. Remember, only the yellow ones are any good. I’m counting on you! / Mushrooms grow in shady spots, right? To be honest, I don’t even like them. / We can’t drink seawater! Look for running water. / You’re good at catching Fish, right?
I’m totally clueless.

You’re hopeless. Okay, let me break it down for you. On the bridge’s near side are three trees, one thinner than the rest. Gulls seem to flock there, so check the area for a Seagull Egg. To get to the top of the fatter trees, climb the thin one and then jump! / Pound on the fat coco palms to shake Coconuts loose. Only the yellow ones are edible. If you keep pounding and don’t get any yellow ones, you should probably try a different tree. / Mushrooms grow in the shade. Check dark areas. If there are any rocks in the way, just move them. Try looking around the base of the watchtower, too. Hmm… They might also be growing in the secret place. / I don’t see any Fish here. Try searching along the shore. They’re usually around the pier, remember? / We can’t drink seawater! Look for running water. You can find freshwater sources both in the cove and near the main beach.
Wow, you didn’t slack off this time! Just kidding. Let’s see, what’s still missing? Fresh Drinking Water, not salt water, okay?
Yep, this should do! Thanks, Sora. / Thanks, Sora! I found something today, too. Here, it’s yours. Tired? Want to call it a day?
Yeah, let’s go home. / Not yet!
Still restless? I hope you’ll be able to wake up tomorrow. / Okay, tomorrow’s the big day. We should rest up!
I wonder where this door leads… No doorknob, no keyhole. What kind of door is this, anyway? / Nothing really out of the ordinary… How did he get here?

This? I’m making a necklace of thalassa shells. In the old days, sailors always wore thalassa shells. They were supposed to ensure a safe voyage. See this? It’s a charm to help us find each other if we ever get separated. The three of us will always be together.
Where did this door come from? Better go find Riku first.
This is totally weird… I’m in another world!

Interactions.Title: Leaving the 1st District Without Meeting Cid

Interactions.Line: There’s gotta be more to see around here… What now?

You looking for someone? It’s a big town, so check everywhere. / I keep seeing new faces today. An odd pair walked by just a little while ago. / I wonder what happened to Mom and Dad…  / Say, are you the one who beat that giant armor thing? No kidding? That’s so cool. / My world was attacked by shadows. I got separated from Mom and Dad, and finally came here.

People with nowhere else to turn come to this town. Where am I from? None of your business. Don’t ask that question here. Everyone’s got an unhappy past. / Those candles burning over there were specially created by moogles. Even if you snuff one out, it flickers back to life in no time. You’d probably need magic to put them all out. / Seeing those shadows reminds me of the day my world was destroyed… Maybe shadows will eventually swallow this world, too. / They say there’s an underground cavern on the outskirts of town. / I heard the old man and his son finally came back. / Fewer refugees are arriving these days. Are the shadows weakening? Or are fewer people escaping? / Leon and his friends try their best, but the shadows keep coming.

Seeing all of this town will take some time, kupo, especially for newcomers. Even if you can’t go to certain areas now, you’ll be able to go later. / The First District is the only safe place, kupo. / Shadows destroyed my world. I’ve got nowhere to go, kupo…  / There’s a ladder outside the Second District’s gizmo shop, kupo. Ah, the view! It’s so beautiful, kupo! / Kupo. My friends live on the accessory shop’s upper floor. They know how to create some rare items, kupo! / Don’t touch my pom pom, kupo! Why does everybody want to touch it, kupo? Pinocchio keeps trying to touch it, too, kupo!
This is the item workshop, kupo. We’re researching item synthesis and super-weapon forging! / Something’s blocking the door, kupo.

Beyond this door is a shortcut to the Third District–but the key’s missing. / This town is divided into three districts. This is the First District. / This town has grown as people have lost their home worlds and come here. It’s easy to get lost in such a big, sprawling place. Be careful. / A talented clock maker has opened a shop here. They say he was swallowed by a whale and managed to escape.

That door leads to the Second District. Beyond that lies the Third District. / You’ll need munny if you want to buy items. No matter where you go, munny talks. / You can find whatever items you need at the nephews’ shop. / I heard the dalmatian puppies got separated and scattered everywhere. Poor things.
The First District is secure. If you run into trouble, come back here. / We’ll guard the First District. Go check out the Second and Third Districts. Show us the power of the Keyblade.

The First District is all clear, but I don’t know about the Third District…  / Can’t get through here. We’ll have to cut across the Second District to reach the Third. / Leon’s probably at the underground cavern. He trains there often. You know, the channel in the alleyway is connected to the cavern.
So you’re the Keyblade master… Please be careful. / I hope they’re safe.
Who?
What do you need?
I’m here to shop. / Gummi menu. / Let’s chat. / Oh, nothing.
Come to me for all your gummi needs, got it? / Come back when you get both navigation gummis. / That castle’s probably crawlin’ with ‘em now…  / Don’t get cocky just ‘cause you’ve been there before.

-MAILBOX- Send 10 postcards to win something! Good luck! / Sent 1st/2nd/3rd/4th/5th/6th/7th/8th/9th/10th postcard. / -MAILBOX- Thanks for sending all 10 postcards! / -MAILBOX- Thanks for the postcards! No more presents.
Looks like it’s locked. / Empty.
Welcome! Wanna buy somethin’? Or sell somethin’?
Welcome! Are you looking to buy? Or maybe you have something to sell?
Hey there! Um… What do you want? Um, what am I supposed to ask? Oh, yeah. Do you wanna buy, or sell?
I’m here to shop. / Oh, nothing.
What do you wanna do?
I want to buy.
All right! What would you like to buy? / You don’t have enough munny!
I want to sell.
Sure! / Thanks! / What do you want to sell? / You don’t have any items!
Never mind.
Okay.
Let’s chat.
Our shop has all sorts of stuff for sale.
I hand-picked everything on these shelves. We carry only the best!
I usually clean, so I’m not used to dealin’ with customers.
We’re gonna earn enough munny here to go on our own adventure. / Sorry, Unca Donald! No family discounts! / Louie does an okay job as long as we keep an eye on him.
Just because we’re kids doesn’t mean we can’t run a business. Sure is good to see you, Unca Donald! Buy a bunch from us! / I did all of the cleaning today. I dare you to find one speck of dust.
I’m in charge of keepin’ the shop clean. Now, my bedroom? That’s tougher! / I’m in charge of keepin’ the shop clean. It’s easier than our bedroom!
Hey there, how can I… Aw, it’s only a kid.
I’m not a kid! And the name’s Sora!
Okay, okay, simmer down. So why the long face, Sora? You lost or somethin’?
No! Well, maybe. Where are we?
Huh?
Traverse Town… So, gramps, is this really another world?
Don’t call me gramps! The name’s Cid! Anyway… Not sure what you’re talkin’ about, but this sure ain’t your island.
Hmm… Guess I’d better start looking for Riku and Kairi.
Well, good luck with whatever it is you’re doing. If you ever run into trouble, you come to me. I’ll look out for you.
What do you need?
I’m here to shop. / Oh, nothing.
So, what’ll it be?
I want to buy.
All right! What would you like to buy? / Thanks! / You don’t have enough munny!
I want to sell.
You got it! / What do you want to sell? / Thanks! / You don’t have any items!
Never mind.
All right. Come again!
Let’s chat.

If you can’t find your buddies, I’ll take care of you. / Still haven’t found ‘em? Keep your chin up. Take another look around town. / Things have disappeared from the shop recently. And these weird noises I keep hearing… Man! / Not much to talk about at the moment.

Welcome! / How may I help you? / Yes, sir. / As you wish. / I’m minding the store for Cid. He’s told me about you. Please come again. / What? You’ve seen me before? Perhaps you’re thinking of someone else? Please come again. / Cid had to go home. He lives in the Third District.
A big tournament is being held somewhere, kupo. / They say a boy won the tournament, kupo. / Kupo? Are you the one winning all the tournaments? We've heard rumors, kupo.
I won’t lie as long as Jiminy’s around! / I wonder where Father could have gone…
-Attention, customers!- You can synthesize items like this one on our second floor, kupo!
Wow, a crystal!
There are traces of fire. / Burning brightly.
It’s those creatures from the island!
It’s a carving of a bell. There seems to be a big bell above the gizmo shop.
Kinda wobbly… Guess I can’t climb it now.
Doesn’t look like he’s here.
Keep looking!

Interactions.Title: Donald and Goofy Miss Sora (Gizmo Shop)

Interactions.Line: Hmph. Where is he?
Leeeooon!

Interactions.Title: Donald and Goofy Miss Sora (Dalmatians’ House)

Interactions.Line: Not here, either.
This could take a while…
Leeeon! Mister Leon?
Where are you?
Looks like it’s locked.
I’ve heard that the Keyblade can open all sorts of locks. Give it a try next time you find a treasure chest or door lock! / Think of this as an adventure! / Hey, cheer up!
It’s dangerous out there. Don’t wander off. / Just can’t sit still, can you?
Bald Mountain - 7:00 am -
Midday Jungle
18:00 in the Past - Time Flies -

The Keyblade can supposedly unlock almost anything. You’re bound to run across treasure chests and other locks. Try it out. / Sooner or later, the Heartless will find you. You’d best prepare yourself.
Prepare myself?
To fight for your life. Are you ready?
Not yet.
We need to move quickly. It’s dangerous here.
I’m ready!
Yuffie, let’s go join Aerith. She should be there by now with the other visitors.
Leon!

Interactions.Title: Sora and Leon in the Alleyway

Interactions.Line: Don’t bother with the small fry. Find the leader! Let’s go!
Make sure  you’re prepared for the journey ahead of you. We don’t know how far the Heartless have spread.
Check out the shops here. They’ve got some pretty neat stuff!
This is from all of us. Spend it as you see fit. And this is from Leon.
Good luck!
I hope you find your friends.
Look out for each other. Keep your spirits up.
The gummi ship is outside that gate.
The what?
That’s our ship.
Wait ‘til you see it!
Hold on. Sora, this is for you. Now you can use magic, too. Goofy, give him that other thing.
What?
You know!
Oh, yeah. Abilities allow you to do all sorts of things. Guess we should look for ‘em along the way, huh?
Okay, is that it? Let’s get going!
Not ‘til we’re ready!
Well, I see big adventures coming their way! Looks like it’s up to me to keep track of it all in my journal!
Hey, look at this mark. I wonder what it is.
There are dalmatians named Pongo and Perdita living in the Second District…
What’s wrong?
They’re quite upset, these dalmatians. They’ve lost their puppies.
Squall can’t stop worrying about them.
Call me Leon.
Sora, would you look for the puppies?
Help them out.
Squa–I mean, Leon–is really cute sometimes.
Please, find the puppies for him.
This is the puppies’ home. When their world disappeared, they were torn away from their family and scattered to other worlds. I bet the little guys are terrified.
They must be.
Sora. I’m countin’ on you.
- Announcement - Our hotel is holding a multicultural art exhibit We hope you enjoy the exhibit. Manager
No vacancy. / Paintings are great…  / If you ever stay the night… Try hitting the clock…
The Autumn Dusk
Midsummer Dawn
There are cords sticking out of this pipe.
It’s emblazoned with a stylized flame.
Well, well. You’ve arrived sooner than I expected.
Wha… You knew we were coming?
Of course.
Are you… a Heartless?
He doesn’t look like one.
Oh, my. No. My name is Merlin. As you can see, I am a sorcerer. I spend much of my time traveling. It’s good to be home. Your king has requested my help.
King Mickey?
Yes, indeed. Donald, Goofy. And who might you be, young man?
I’m Sora.
Ah. So, you have found the key.
What did the king ask you to do?

Just a moment… Presto! There, now. Ahem. Your king asked me to train you in the art of magic. We can start anytime you like. Let me know when you’re ready to begin the training. Oh, and one more thing.
Hello. I’m the Fairy Godmother. Your king asked me to help, too. I will assist throughout your journey.
I do not know how much I can be of help, but do stop by anytime.
I’m so worried about Cinderella. / My world has disappeared, too. / Sora, please help everyone.

You’re making excellent progress. Here’s something for your effort. Keep it up. / You’re becoming a real sorcerer. Here’s something for your effort. I’d better get busy too.  / Well! This is quite impressive. Here’s something for your effort. It’s very special. Take good care of it. / Yes?
Practice magic. / To the cavern. / Go back. / Never mind.
Which type of target?
Moving. / Stationary.
Off we go!
I’ll leave the book here. Look at it whenever you like. Be sure to see Cid first.
You’d best go see Cid before going anywhere else.
The green cursor shows your current position. Select your next destination with the cursor.
Observe the battle LV when selecting destinations. More ★ means stronger Heartless in that world.
There’s a tournament being held at the Coliseum.
I hear there’s a great reward for the winner. / The competition’s a lot tougher now, so be careful.
We can revisit some places and unseal more Trinities.
Wasn’t there a Trinity Mark in the accessory shop?
Could this torn page be from Merlin’s book?
Let’s return to town and give it to him.
I think my magic is as good as Donald’s now.
No way! Not in a million years.
Why don’t you go see Merlin? Work more on your magic.
All right! Let’s head on to the new world!
Hold on, Donald. We don’t know what’s out there. Why don’t we revisit other worlds first? I’m sure we’ll find some new items.
There’s a new warp hole near Traverse Town.
I wonder where it leads… Hmm. Some weird power is emanating from the worlds.
Might be worth revisiting some places again.
Great job! You've completed all the missions! Here's Bahamut and a Crown-G as a reward.
Now try the gummi ship missions on FINAL MIX
We travel to different worlds on the gummi ship.
The Heartless ships often give us a hard time.
Always be on the lookout during flight.
Your journey will be documented until you reach your destination.
Seek out the missions each world has to offer!
Control the gummi ship using the left stick. Tilt it up to descend, and tilt down to ascend.
The blue gauge shows the power level. Firing lasers, among other things, consumes power. The green gauge shows the strength of the armor. If it reaches zero, it’s back to the departing point.
Equipped a radar gummi. Note bottom-left corner.
Equipped a speed gummi. It enables acceleration. / The shield gummi. Protects the ship against attacks.
Bring me evidence of Alice’s innocence! Fail, and it’s off with all of your heads! Gather as much of little evidence as you please. Report back here once you’re ready.
Who are you?
I’m Sora.
I’m Goofy, and that there’s Donald.
Pleased to meet you, though I do wish it were under better circumstances. I’m sorry you got mixed up in this nonsense.
Why are you on trial in the first place?
I should like to know the very same thing! Apparently I was guilty from the moment I took the stand!
That’s crazy! So, where are you from?
Hmm, curious. I can’t quite remember. You see, I found this mysterious rabbit  hole. When I tried to peek inside, I tumbled in head over heels… And I found myself here.
So you’re from another world!
That’s funny. Maybe you don’t need a ship, then.
I don’t get it.
What do you mean “another world”?
Enough! The defendant will be silent!

Oh, if only I hadn’t peeked inside that rabbit hole… I guess I’m a bit too curious for my own good. I asked this Cheshire Cat how to get home. And he told me to ask the queen. So I came here to see her, and I was arrested. She simply refuses to listen to me. It’s so unfair… I haven’t done anything wrong. What shall I do? I should like to keep my head. Why, if my head and body become separated, nothing I eat will reach my stomach! / It’s in your hands now.

Before you sits Her Royal Majesty, the noble Queen of Hearts. / The queen is always right. / No one has ever questioned her judgment at a trial. / The queen’s word is law here. / You can only pick one. Choose carefully. / The queen has spoken! Find Alice at once! / Court is in recess until the girl is found! / The queen demands immediate satisfaction. / We will resume the trial once you capture the guilty party. / The queen is tired of waiting. / Oh me, oh my. The shadows have made the queen quite furious. / B-But I’m sure she’ll have no trouble dealing with them. / As long as our queen reigns, we have nothing to fear.

You’d better bring your evidence soon. / How dare you stand there! / Well, what are you staring at? / Get on with it! / Quit dawdling! / You’re not hiding anything from me, are you? / Find Alice, or else! / Are you certain? No second chances!
I’m sure. / Let me think it over.

Now we shall see who the real culprit is. / Hurry up! / You still haven’t found a new suspect? Slowpoke. / Can’t we continue the trial, already? / Trial? I’m far too busy for that now! / Hear me, shadows! Someday you, too, will be judged!

Do not speak to the defendant! / Don’t even think about it. / The girl’s not going anywhere. / Quit loitering! Do you want to be arrested, too? / No use stalling. Hurry up and choose. / I just looked away for a moment, and… / The queen is furious. We must find Alice quickly. / If we don’t find her, it’ll mean all our heads. / I might be the next one to stand trial. / Who could’ve abducted Alice? / We’ve reinforced the bars. No one will ever escape this cage again. / I must guard the cage, even if it’s empty! The queen has ordered it. / The darkness appears to be growing in power. / I won’t leave my post, no matter what.

I did see someone suspicious. You. / Hmph, why should I help you? / You shouldn’t have gotten involved. / You’re wasting your time. / The trial can resume if you bring in at least one piece of evidence. / Just make up your mind already! / Where did that girl disappear to? / Keep looking. She can’t have gone far. / Hurry, or you, too, will incur the queen’s wrath. / This is no time for idle chatter. Find her! / I’ll bet you’re all behind this. / Who’ll be the next to stand trial? / Perhaps those shadows carried Alice off. Then again, they just seem to be mindless beings. / Someone controlled by the darkness must be behind this. / I don’t know what they’re after.

Do not anger the queen. She’s really scary. / Trust me, you don’t want to get on her bad side. No one defies the queen and keeps his head. / I just want this whole thing to end. / We can’t resume the trial without evidence. / Your best bet might be to find as much proof as you can. / Why not just choose the one you found? / Oww. Why did you hit me so hard? / I hate fighting, but I have my orders. / What happened? She just vanished into thin air! / I have no idea where she might be. / Ah, I’ve had enough of trials. / Oops! Don’t tell anyone I said that. / Battling darkness has left no time for trials. / Beware, for danger lurks beyond these walls. / Will the trial resume once the darkness is gone?
Go and find proof of her innocence. / Don’t keep the queen waiting. / There’s no use stalling. / Are you ready to present your evidence before the queen? / Make your choice! You’re doomed anyway.
Yes. / Not yet.
Very well. Counsel, step up to the podium. / Keep the queen waiting at your own peril.
Gawrsh, your guess is as good as mine.
You’d better pick the right one!
Without a defendant, there’s no trial. / Find Alice and bring her here! / Failure will not be tolerated.

We cannot hold a trial without a suspect. / Report to us immediately when you find Alice. / The darkness is nothing to fear. / On our honor, we will protect the queen. / Stop loitering or you’ll be arrested, too.

Still can’t find her? / We can’t help you. Our duty is to guard the queen. / If those shadows return, we will fight them off. / Are you in league with the shadows? / We can protect the queen. We don’t need your help.
Who are you?
Who, indeed? Poor Alice. Soon to lose her head, and she’s not guilty of a thing!
Hey, if you know who the real culprit is, tell us!
The Cheshire Cat has all the answers–but doesn’t always tell. The answer, the culprit, the cat all lie in darkness.
Wait!
They’ve already left the forest. I won’t tell which exit. There are four pieces of evidence in all. Three are a cinch to find. The fourth is tricky. Big reward if you find them all.
Should we trust him?
To trust, or not to trust? I trust you’ll decide!
Give me a Potion and I’ll make you bigger.
Give me a Potion. / Thanks.
Give me an Elixir. / Thanks. / The room at the center of this world has a secret.
Give me a Potion. / Thanks. / This forest has all kinds of paths.
Give me an Ether. / Thanks. / Many strangers lately.
Give me an Ether. / Thanks. / The bizarre room holds all the answers.
Give me a Hi-Potion. / Thanks. / One of our friends has a mysterious power.
Shock me!
Why don’t you get on? / See ya.
I’m ripe enough to be picked and eaten. / It’s too big to eat.
Oh, my head! / Wheee!
Well, look what you’ve found. Nice going.
Now we can save Alice.
Don’t be so sure! She may be innocent, but what about you?
What do you mean?
I won’t tell. But I’ll give you something.
Now, show me what you have found.
Well, that’s certainly a lot of evidence, but I’m still not impressed. / That’s it? I expected more than that!
Cards! Bring forth my evidence! Hmm, checking all five would only be a waste of time. All right, then. Choose the one you wish to present. I’ll decide who’s guilty based on that evidence.
What? After all the trouble of collecting it?
You dare object? Then you will lose your head! Now, choose! One box!
What in the world was that?
There’s your evidence. Alice is innocent.
Rrrrrrrgh… Silence! I’m the law here! Article 29
That’s crazy!
Seize them at once!
What! So you’re the culprits!
Wait! This can’t be right.
You’re all guilty! Seize them!
Sora! Do something!
We have no choice! Let’s take ‘em!
Cards! If they touch the tower, you lose your heads!
She must’ve gotten kidnapped while we were fighting.
You fools! Find the one who’s behind this! I don’t care how!
Have you seen Alice?
Alice, no. Shadows, yes!
Where did they go?
This way? That way? Does it matter? Left, right, up, down! All mixed up thanks to the shadows! Step deeper into the forest to the deserted garden. You might find shadows in the upside-down room!
A very merry unbirthday. Sit down to get your present.
They’re hiding somewhere. And the momeraths outgrabe. Want to find the shadows? Try turning on the light.
It’s too dim. Make it brighter.
What next?
One more lamp that you need to light.
All the lights are on. You’ll see the shadows soon. They’ll arise in this room, but somewhere else. The shadows might go after that doorknob, too.
You’ll have a better view from higher up.
The shadows should be here soon. Are you prepared for the worst? If not, too bad!
What was that?
You hear that? Sounded like something closed.
This gummi ain’t like the others. No, sir.
Okay, I’ll hold on to it.
Splendid. You’re quite the hero. But there’s something you’re missing.
What?
I won’t tell. But I’ll give you something. If you’re looking for Alice, she’s not here. She’s gone! Off with the shadows, into darkness.
No…
Let’s go back to our gummi ship. We might find her in another world.
We’ve gotta go to a save point to return to our ship.
Something is stuck inside. / Nothing of importance is written.
You still haven’t found a new suspect? Slowpoke. / Can’t we continue the trial, already?
We will resume the trial once you capture the guilty party. / The queen is tired of waiting.
We cannot hold a trial without a suspect. / Report to us immediately when you find Alice.
Still can’t find her? / We can’t help you. Our duty is to guard the queen.
Who could’ve abducted Alice? / We’ve reinforced the bars. No one will ever escape this cage again.
I’ll bet you’re all behind this. / Who’ll be the next to stand trial?
Ah, I’ve had enough of trials. / Oops! Don’t tell anyone I said that.

The games start soon. Now’s the time to train. / It’s time to go from junior hero to real hero. / Are you going to compete? It would be great to face you! / Phil wasn’t happy that I lost to you. Said I was getting soft. / You beat me last time, but next time won’t be so easy.
Burning brightly. What’ll happen if it goes out? / Blizzard can’t put it out. Try a more powerful spell. / Burned out.

The next event is coming soon! Don’t miss it! / Calling all heroes! Sign up now for the games! / A new hero has appeared in the games! Sora! / Can anyone defeat Sora? All challenges, to the Coliseum! / Don’t miss the Hades Cup! Surprises aplenty! / Sora dominates the games! A new hero is born!
Aspiring heroes, try your strength in the Phil Cup! / Spread your wings, future heroes! The Pegasus Cup starts soon! / Zero or Hero? Find out at the Hercules Cup!
Empty.
Lobby Dialogue (First Visit)
It weighs a ton!
This trial is tough. You got what it takes? You ready?
I’m ready! / I need more time.
Okay, kid. Let’s see what you’ve got. / Lost your nerve, kid?
Sorry, can’t let ya into the games just yet, but I can train ya for ‘em!
Let’s start training!
Easy. / Advanced. / Forget it.
You got it. Remember, ya gotta train to win.
I’m ready for the games!
You don’t get it, do ya? No entry pass for you.
I hope Herc’s okay. Wish I could go in! / You want to compete? Come back later, would ya? We’re not ready yet. You can train with the barrels, if you want.
The rules are simple
Not bad! For a beginner, that is. / Hey, you’re better than I thought! /That’s it! Sorry, time’s up. You’d better give up.
I’m not quitting. / I give up.
That’s the spirit! All right, here we go! / Well, it just ain’t your time yet. Keep at it and you’ll get there!
Wanna become a real hero? Start by mastering this spell.
Hey, how’d you get this?
Can we enter the games now?
Well… I guess so. We start with the preliminaries! Ready for the preliminaries?
Yeah, let’s go! / Give me a second.
Some real weirdos signed up for the games. Better watch yourself. / Good call. Preparation is key! Rule 8
Some real weirdos signed up for the games. Things are gonna heat up, so you’d better be ready. The prelims start soon. You gonna compete?
You’re no heroes yet, but you ain’t doing bad. Lucky you came to me for coaching. Something tells me he’ll be a tough one to beat. Who knows, maybe you’ll end up facing him.
Say, you’re better than I thought, kid! Wish he was here to see this.
Who?
Hercules. He’s a hero if ever there was one. Too bad he’s off visiting his father.
Whew, that was close! That was Cerberus, the guardian of the Underworld. Herc should be able to handle him. But then again, maybe not… This doesn’t look good.
Kid, you’re not entering the arena, are ya? This ain’t just some match. This is for real!
I’m not afraid. / Maybe I’ll wait.
You can decide if I’m hero material or not.
Careful, kid!
That’s right, stay out of it. You’re not ready to face Cerberus.
Lobby Text + Dialogue
You know the rules, right? Which tournament do you wanna enter?
Phil Cup. / Pegasus Cup. / Hercules Cup. / Hades Cup. / ????? / Gold Match. / Platinum Match. / Don’t enter.
How do you wanna go about it? / Which seed do you want to start at? / What, you’re ducking out? Can’t be a hero if you don’t try?
Enter together. / Enter alone; just Sora. / Set time limit. / 50th./49th./40th./39th./30th./29th./20th./19th./10th./9th. / Don’t enter.
1. In the games, the only thing you can hurt is your pride. Fight hard! 2. You can forfeit any time. Fight as much as you like! 3. No summoning allowed! Fight with your own strength!
DO NOT ENTER!
Will not open.
Phil Cup Championship Trophy
Pegasus Cup Championship Plaque
Hercules Cup Championship Trophy
Hades Cup Championship Trophy
Hey, Donald, maybe King Mickey’s down there.
In a backwater place like that? No way! Let’s move on.
Hold on. Riku and Kairi might be down there. Let’s just check it out.
Forget it! We’re on an important mission!
Just land!
No!
Come on!
Aw, phooey!
We’re landing!
Don’t touch that! Nooo!

The flower is wilted. / What would make it bloom? / Hitting it won’t make it bloom. / See if it blooms by casting magic on it. / What will happen if all the flowers bloom? / When Heartless  draw near, the flowers grow black.
The big black fruit looks suspicious.

Clayton’s the name. I’m a hunter, not a researcher. What? No, I am not going to hunt the gorillas. But they’re so rare! I’d just like to get a look at them. / I’ve no doubt Tarzan knows where the nesting grounds are. He just won’t tell us where, for some reason.
Recipe Card 1 Light the stove. Be careful.
Recipe Card 2 Put the Potion in the pot quickly.
Research Note 1 (Recipe for Ether) Ingredients
Research Note 2 (Recipe for Ether) Ice the ingredient.
Research Note 3 (Replication Experiment) Replicating items.

Cooking Pot. Find the 2 recipe cards. / Need more information. Find Recipe Card 1 / 2. Required cards found. Let’s begin. Potion is in the pot. It’s ready to be heated. Light it. / Light the stove. / The stove has been lit. Cooking… Ready! Obtained Hi-Potion. / Done.

Lab instruments. Find the 2 research notes. / Need more information. Find Research Note 1 / 2. Required notes found. Let’s begin. Starting the experiment. The Potion was put in. After putting in the ingredient, ice it. / Now, it just needs to be cooled. / A reaction has started. The item is changing. / Conducting the replication experiment using note 3. Experiment successful! Obtained Ether. Completed experiment.

Interactions.Title: Sora, Donald, and Goofy in the Tent

Interactions.Line: What’s that?
A gummi block. It’s the same stuff used to build our ship.
So that means…
The king could be here. So, we’ve gotta work together to look for him. For now.
Fine. I’ll let you tag along. For now.
Apparently Tarzan was raised in the jungle by the gorillas. Communicating with him still isn’t easy, but he’s learning.
So he was speaking in “gorilla” back there…
Ah, that’s right. You’re looking for your friends?
He said Riku and Kairi are here. And one word I couldn’t understand…
Why don’t we try this? We’ll show Tarzan some slides and see if any of them match that word. Oh, what happened to the slides?

Did you find the slides? They must be lying around the camp somewhere… You can view the slides with the projector. I think there may be 6/5/4/3/2/1 more. / Gorillas are quite cautious. We can’t find their nest anywhere.  / Don’t mind Mr. Clayton. He’s not a bad person–just a bit impetuous.  I wish I could go, too. But gorillas are wary of strangers, so the smaller the group, the better. / Swinging on the vines is the only way through the treetops. Perhaps you’ll find the leader of the gorillas up in the treetops.

The gorilla in the tree house may be in danger. / Oh, I hope the gorillas by the cliff are all right. / The gorillas in the bamboo thicket might be in trouble. / I’m rather worried about the gorillas around the climbing trees. Please, protect the gorillas.
I do hope Mr. Clayton is safe…
Hello. Please make yourselves at home. / Tarzan took me down the slider. Oh, it was so thrilling! You should try it too, Sora.
What’s wrong, Sora?
What? Um… Nothing. This place… It just looks so familiar. But how? I’ve never been off my island.
He seemed sorta distracted by something.
Was he looking toward the tree house?
Hey, where’s Jane?
What’s wrong, Tarzan?
Something coming. Jane, danger. Jane near… Near tree house.
Sounds like trouble. Let’s go.
Clayton came to the tent, and… That’s the last thing I remember.
Clayton?
Gorillas trapped. Terk ran.
We must help the gorillas!
Well, guess we’d better get going.
Where is your ship, anyway?
Well, uh… Not too far.
Sora, Tarzan, friends.
The gummi block that came out of that glowing hole… It’s not like the others. Wonder what it’s used for.
I dunno.
Maybe Leon’ll know.
Hmm… He might. Back to Traverse Town, then?
I wanna be pilot!
Hey, stop it!
Oh, come on! I’m the Keyblade master.
I don’t care who you are! No!
Here we go again…
The clock is stuck at 6:54.

Interactions.Title: Leon and Aerith in the Secret Waterway

Interactions.Line: So, you found the Keyhole.
Yeah. The Keyblade locked it automatically.
Good.
Every world among the stars has a Keyhole. And each one leads to the heart of that world. There must be one in this town as well.
What do you mean?
It was in Ansem’s report.
The Heartless enter through the Keyhole and do something to the world’s core.
What happens to the world?
In the end, it disappears.
What!
What!
What!
That’s why your key is so important.
Please lock the Keyholes. You're the only one who can.
I don’t know…
Seeing other worlds would probably serve you well.
Yeah!
We gotta find your friends! And King Mickey!
I guess you’re right… Okay!
Hey, Leon. This gummi block’s different from the others. Do you know what it’s for?
Ask Cid. He should know.
Wait, Sora. Take this with you. This stone holds some mysterious power. I’ve been carrying it for luck. I want you to hold onto it.
How do you use it?
This place is so mysterious. / Please lock the Keyholes.
Uh, Leon?

What a mysterious mural… It’s almost hypnotizing. / There’s something about this musty place…  / It’s my lucky charm. Be sure to bring it back to me. / Don’t ever forget. Wherever you go, I’m always with you.
What’ve you got there? Hey! Well, if it ain’t a gummi block.
Yup.
What’s this one for?
You’re kiddin’ me! You’re flyin’ a gummi ship and you don’t know nothin’ about navigation gummis? Bunch of pinheads. Interspace ain’t no playground.
There’s a lot we don’t know. So what! We have to use the gummi ship to go to other worlds. We don’t have a choice.
Whoa, easy. I didn’t know. No hard feelings, all right? Well, I guess I coud lend y’all a hand, then.
Thanks.
Basically, with navigation gummis, you can go to new places. You want one on your ship, right? I’ll install it for you. But I got this thing I gotta go deliver first.
What do you need to deliver?

Just this book. It’s real old. When the guy brought it in, it was practically falling apart. Too beat up to restore it to the way it was. But overall, I did a decent job puttin’ it back together. Anyway, you mind deliverin’ it for me? It’s the old house past the Third District. Look for a big fire sign.
Wh-What was that?
Hmm? The bell at the gizmo shop is ringing. Go check it out if you want, but deliver that book for me first. When you’re done, stop by the house in the Third District. I’ll be there.
Hmm… Two of these probably make a set. This thing’s useless by itself. You need the other gummi. Come back here when you find the other one, all right?

Interactions.Title: Merlin’s Book and Fairy Godmother’s Spell

Interactions.Line: Oh, that book… So, Cid asked you to bring this. Thank you. You wish to know what kind of book it is? I don’t even know, myself. In fact, it’s not mine. Somehow it found its way into my bag one day. It was such a curious book, I asked Cid to repair it for me. Well, I guess I’ll put it here somewhere, for now. This book holds a great secret. The missing pages will unlock it. I’ll leave the book over there. Do look at it whenever you like. My best regards to Cid for repairing it for me. Oh, and about that stone of yours… You should ask the Fairy Godmother about that.
Do  you know what this is?
Oh, the poor thing! He has turned into a summon gem.
A summon gem?

This little creature lived in a world that was consumed by the Heartless. When a world vanishes, so do its inhabitants. But this one had such a strong heart, he became a gem instead of vanishing with his world.
Can he regain himself?

Yes, but only his spirit. Now, watch! Bibbity bobbity boo! Whenever you call, he will help you. If you find any more of these, bring them to me. Don’t worry, when their worlds are restored they will return there. Sora, please help save them.
Don’t worry, I will.

Oh, that’s called a navigation gummi? / We will try to find out what Maleficent is up to. / Thank you, Sora. You’re the only one who can stop the Heartless. / I thought the Keyhole would strengthen the darkness. I mean, the darkness is strong, but still… It’s almost as if someone is holding the darkness back. / I think Cid knows a way to get to Hollow Bastion. / We have to close the Keyhole before the darkness overwhelms us.

This room will be our secret base. It’s nice and snug here. / Show us how it’s done, Keyblade master! I sure envy you for seeing a Keyhole. Well, next time! / Not sure why, but the Heartless are getting stronger. New types of Heartless are popping up all over the place! If anything happens to us, I know we can count on you, Sora. / Super strong Heartless are showing up all over. Wipe them out, Sora! / I wonder if Ansem is waiting in Hollow Bastion?

Don’t you have to go see Cid? / So that was a summon gem… Interesting. / So this town had a Keyhole as well… Hurry, Sora. The Heartless are growing stronger every minute. / It seems the other princesses have been freed as well. Jasmine apparently hasn’t returned to Agrabah. I suspect the others are still in the castle, too. / Has the darkness taken them, too? Maybe it’s hopeless for ordinary people to oppose the darkness. / Why would they stay in that castle?
See me at the First District.
Sora, are you feeling okay now? If you’re not, then say so. / I wonder how Riku’s doing…  / Even in your Heartless form, I knew it was you.
You guys ever hear of Maleficent? I hear she’s in town.
Who is she?
A witch, man, she’s a witch!
She’s the reason this town is full of Heartless. Don’t take her lightly.
She’s been using the Heartless for years.
We lost our world, thanks to her.
One day, a swarm of Heartless took over our world!
That was nine years ago.
I got out of that mess and came here with these guys.
That’s awful!
Our ruler was a wise man named Ansem. He dedicated his life to studying the Heartless.
His report should tell us how to get rid of the Heartless.
Where’s this report?
We don’t know. It got scattered when our world was destroyed.
I’m sure Maleficent’s got most of the pages.

So, you delivered that book? That navigation gummi’s installed and ready to go. You find another one, you bring it to me. I threw in a warp gummi for the heck of it. Now  you can jump to worlds you’ve been to before. Well, better get back to my real job. What’s my real job? You’ll see. See me at the First District.
I’ve been thinking about the bell in the Second District.
The one that rang a bit ago?
The one above the gizmo shop. There’s a legend about it, you know.
But it’s all boarded up. Nobody can get in there.
Heck, go check it out. Ring it three times to see if anything happens.

Hey, now that was quick! Now you know. I’m in the gummi block business. Workin’ on your gummi ship sure was great. Come again and I’ll give you a big discount. Go ahead, take it. It’s a special giveaway.
Hey, got another navigation gummi there, eh? I’ll bet you want it installed.
Yeah, please.
Hmm… Looks like this is another one of those blocks that come in sets. You gotta find the mate to this one.
Pinocchio! Are you telling me the truth?
Yes!
Then tell me, what is this?
It was a present.
No fibbing, now! You know you’re not supposed to tell lies. A lie only grows and grows, ‘til you get caught! Plain as the nose on your face!
But if you want something, why wait? Why not just take it?
Oh, my! Who told you that? You need some advice from your conscience!
That’s right! You’re my conscience, Jiminy! I’ll never tell lies as long as you’re around.
You need to be good so you can become a real boy. You promised Geppetto you would be, right?
Oh! Do you know where Father is?
He’s not with you?
Jiminy, let’s go find Father!
Now, hold on! There are all sorts of dangers and temptations out there! I’ll go find Geppetto, so you just wait here. These fellows here will be helping me.
We will?
Well, shall we go, Sora?
You could’ve asked us first…
We’re the champs!
I never thought you’d do it. Not bad.
Phil, you’re just as stubborn as ever. Don’t pretend you’re not happy for them!
Ahem! Now, kid, you’ve still got a long way to go. The next round’s startin’ soon. Next time it’ll be the real thing.
I’m Jasmine. My father is the sultan of Agrabah.
Uh… So that makes you a princess.
But he has been deposed by Jafar, who now controls the city.
Jafar?

You haven’t heard of him? He’s the royal vizier. He’s gained evil powers and seized Agrabah. He’s desperately looking for something–something he calls the “Keyhole.” Jafar caught me trying to escape, but he helped me.
Who helped you?
We were hiding nearby, but he left a while ago to take care of something… Oh, I hope Aladdin’s all right.
A gate opened somewhere.
We’re barely scraping by.
I want to buy. / I want to sell. / I don’t need anything.
What’s the matter? You want to go somewhere? I’ll ride on the carpet. / I’ll leave him alone.
The carpet flew off for the desert. Let’s follow it, Sora! / But let’s explore the city more.
It wants us to come along?
All aboard. / Forget it.
So, Jafar is after Jasmine and this “Keyhole.”
Keyhole, eh? I could swear I’ve heard about that somewhere before…
Really? Where?
Now, where was it? It’s only been 200 years…
Well, anyway, we’ve got to stop Jafar before it’s too late.
This pillar probably rises all the way to the top. / Maybe if you break it…
I think she only passed out. We gotta go after Jafar first.
So, Jasmine’s no longer in Agrabah. Sora, let’s go find her.
Sorry. I can’t take you with me.
Wh-Why not?
I sure wish we could…
But we can’t. If we take him to another world, we would be…
Muh… Mudd–
Meddling!
Aladdin, we’ll find Jasmine. I promise.
Here. Take this with you. Sora, please find Jasmine for me.
Travelers used to throng Agrabah’s streets. But now those shadows have overrun the city. / They’re everywhere! It’s bad for business. / I’d leave, but there’s nowhere to go.
The streets are practically deserted now. Everyone’s hiding from the shadows. / I hear the shadows have kidnapped the princess. / Will they ever leave?
We can’t play outside anymore, thanks to those shadows. Too dangerous. / All my friends are hiding at home. / If I were bigger, I’d beat those shadows up!
Do you remember seeing a man with spiky hair at the coliseum?
Yup.
I wonder if he’s still searching for his friend? Sora. If you see him, please tell him to be careful. He’s not that friendly, but we all care about him dearly.

First you have to listen to his explanation, kupo. / Someday we’ll make the ultimate weapon, kupo! So bring us all the items you can, kupo! / Our repertoire of new items is growing, kupo! / You should make a ribbon as a present to her, kupo! / We can make items like the ultimate weapon and other great weapons, kupo! / You’re pretty good at this, kupo. We hereby declare you a master synthesist, kupo! Just kidding, kupo.

We can use your items to make unusual new items, kupo! Let us make something for you, kupo! Bring back a bunch of items from your travels, kupo! / Thanks for helping us make so many items, kupo! But, we want to make even more unusual items, kupo. Be sure to look everywhere you go for items, kupo! / Be sure to look everywhere you go for items, kupo! / !
First you have to listen to his explanation, kupo. / Welcome, kupo!
Let’s synthesize! / I’ll be back.

Select an item to synthesize, kupo! The ingredients list is on the right. / Not enough ingredients, kupo! / There you go, kupo! / Hold on, kupo! Here, take this, kupo! Equip it to gather items more easily, kupo!
What is that?
Wow, it’s huge!
It’s a giant whale!
It’s Monstro! He’s a whale of a whale, and vicious besides!
Whoa! Sora, get us out of here!
Too late! He’s going to swallow us!

I’ve warned him not to wander off here. He can be a naughty boy. Even so, he’s very precious to me. / Where in the world has he gone off to? I hate to trouble you, but please bring him back. / This thing can really help us get out of here? A most interesting substance. Hmm…  / It’s easy to get lost inside of Monstro. It helps to use the crates and barrels as landmarks. / Beware of the green monsters floating around. They’ll try to drive you deeper into Monstro. I hope that’s not what happened to Pinocchio. / Pinocchio means everything to me. I don’t know what I’d do without him. / I’d look for him myself, but I’m too old. If only I could do more for him. / No matter what that boy says, Pinocchio hasn’t lost his heart! / Above the entrance leading into Monstro’s depths, there’s another entrance. That second entrance may lead someplace you haven’t yet seen. But it’s impossible to jump up there. It’s much too high. You’d need special powers, I suppose.
I sure hope Pinocchio and Geppetto are okay.
Yeah, hopefully they landed safely somewhere.
Riku…
Pinocchio?
Hey, it’s Sora!
Well, hello, Sora!
How did you get here?

A man named Leon helped us. He even got us this house to live in. I don’t know how I’ll ever repay his kindness. Say, I hear you three are fighting the Heartless. I thought I might be able to help you, so I made this.
For us?
But of course! Pinocchio and I can’t thank you enough! We’ll do anything we can to help you.

I’m being good, even without Jiminy’s help. / Father’s really interested in the gummi blocks. / I’m studying real hard so I can become a real boy. I’m not fibbing! See? My nose is just the same. / Sora, look! This was my idea! You can have it!

Ah, Sora. Look what I’ve cooked up this time! There you go. / If Pinocchio becomes a real boy, I’m sure he’ll be just like you. / Maybe I can make a better ship for you someday. Please visit any time. Pinocchio would be glad to see you, too. / Those gummi blocks are very curious. I’d like to experiment with them a bit.
Oh, another summon gem? Let’s help this little one. Here we go! Bibbity  bobbity boo! If you find any more of these stones, bring them to me.
That was great! Looks like Phil’s trained another great hero!
Is strength the most important part of a hero?
Well, what you really need is a strong heart. What makes a strong heart? If you have to ask, you’re not a hero yet!
Stop talking in riddles!
It’s not a riddle!
Okay, guys. Prepare for landing.
Land where? In the sea? We’ll drown!
Not with my magic, we won’t. Just leave it to me.
Easy for you to say...Okay, it’s time for you to learn how to swim properly. Practice swimming with Flounder. Try to tag him. All right. Begin.
Keep at it. / No, not that way!
Good luck! / Wow! Nice job!
Those creatures chased us here.
Oh, no! Those monsters might be heading for the palace, too!
We’d better head back right away!
But, wh-what if we run into more on our way back?
I’m sorry, but we need your help. Please come back to the palace with us. The trident markers on the walls point the way there. We won’t get lost as long as we follow them. Okay, let’s get going.
Hitting it might open it.
Hitting it won’t open it. How about magic?
Hitting it won’t open it. How about magic?
Hitting it won’t open it. How about magic?
It’s stuck in the hole. How can it be pulled out?
The water is rippling. Try hitting it.

Ariel is a princess of Atlantica. But she’s always swimming off from the palace and doing as she pleases. That girl ought to behave more like a princess. / King Triton is the ruler of Atlantica. Wielding his mighty trident, he keeps peace throughout the seas. That Ariel makes him worry so much! But the willful child doesn’t even realize it. / Once, a fortune-teller named Ursula lived in the palace. Oh, she was talented, but treacherous, too. She was good at coaxing others into doing evil. In time, her wicked deeds enraged the king, and he banished her. / Strange visitors have come to Atlantica lately. The palace is safe, under His Majesty’s protection. But there are dangers outside the palace. And still that girl refuses to listen to me. / Ursula’s gone and the trident has been recovered. What a relief. Now if only Ariel would settle down a bit…  / I want to get back to writing symphonies. Who am I kidding… That girl will keep me busy forever.

You came all this way swimming like that? Hmm. / Whoever you are, I want to thank you for helping Ariel. / Ursula seems to come from the direction of the sunken ship. I’ve heard there’s some contraption on the wall behind the shipwreck. / You’ve all become much better swimmers. You’ve even learned to make headway against strong currents. / The currents bring signs of darkness. Who knows what lies in that grotto…  / The time has come to use your key. The Keyhole is in Ariel’s grotto. She never knew of its existence. Maybe her longing for other worlds drew it to her. / I seem to have misjudged you all. Ariel is safe and sound, and the trident has been returned, thanks to you. I did not trust you, and for that I apologize. / Mark me, key bearer. Use the key with caution. If mishandled, it may bring unspeakable calamity… Just like my trident. Take heed. / Guard it well. It must not fall under the sway of darkness.
Come to my grotto. I want to show you something. There it is. See?
Look at all the wonderful things Flounder and I’ve collected. I think it’s all from the outside world. Someday, I’m going to see what’s out there. I want to see other worlds. Does that sound strange?
No. Not at all. I used to feel the same way.
Used to?
I mean… I still do.
Hey, why don’t we try looking for that Keyhole that you were talking about?
But your father said–
Oh, he treats me like a little girl. He never wants to let me do anything. He just… He just doesn’t understand.

There’s this really big fish who can swim against the current. But he’s scared of those weird things swimming around. So if we chase them away, I think the big fish’ll play with us. Maybe if you grab onto him, he’ll take you somewhere. / There’s a shape here that looks just like that crystal you have. / Where did Ariel go? I want to go look for her, but I’m s-sorta scared. / There’s this strange boulder by the sunken ship. It has some kind of marking on it. / I made a new friend who took me way out, against the current. And I saw this weird cave, but I was too scared to go inside. / The waters feel calm now– probably because Ursula’s gone. / Me and Ariel are gonna go play. But don’t tell the king, okay?

You’ve been traveling to many different worlds, right? Come back someday and tell me all about it, okay? / Ever since that incident, Daddy’s tried to be more understanding. He’s not as over-protective as he used to be. But he still doesn’t like me going out. Sebastian has kept an eye on me wherever I go. / Just you watch. Someday I’ll travel to other worlds, too. I’ll keep looking for a door to lead me there. The search for that door is sort of my road to maturity. Sora, have you found your door yet?
Huh? / What is that thing? / If only I could reach it…
Isn’t there something else you should be doing? / This isn’t the time!
Hm. Its shape reminds me of something…
Ursula draws power from her cauldron. To defeat Ursula, you must strike her cauldron with magic.
Need some help? I’ll show you how it’s done.
It’s all clogged up. Let’s look for another way.
It’s closed tight. Magic probably won’t work.
A sea urchin is hiding.
Daddy, I’m so sorry.
Please don’t be angry with her.
It’s my fault. You followed Ursula because… I wouldn’t let you follow your heart. And when you found that crystal, I lost my temper and destroyed it.
Oh, yeah, the crystal! Why did you destroy it?
That crystal held the power to reveal the Keyhole. The Keyhole is dangerous. I had to keep you away from it at any cost.
Daddy…
Key bearer, I have one more request
Of course. That’s what we had in mind from the start.
Where is the Keyhole, Daddy?
You should know better than anyone. It’s in your grotto.
Really… Sora, let’s go.
This is from my collection. I want you to have it.
This sure is a spooky place. I’ll bet the people here are scary-lookin’ too.
Don’t worry. We look spooky, too. If they scare us, we’ll scare them right back!
You think so?

That’s quite the costume! Welcome to Halloween Town! To our town, Halloween means everything. Jack and the rest of us are always looking for new ways to scare people. / These Heartless folks look great, don’t they? This year’s theme is “The Heartless Halloween!” Luckily, Jack found a book that talks about the Heartless.
You’re really gonna unlock it for them?
Why not? If they succeed, we won’t have to fight the Heartless, right? Besides, I want to see the Heartless dance, too. Don’t you?
Not really.

Sally should have the “memory” we need, but she’s not here. Where could that girl be? /  You might find Sally at her favorite place. You know, where people nap forever. Can you guess where? / I can’t get anything done without Sally! What a nuisance! / Now all we need is “surprise.” I’ve left that to the mayor. / All I’ll say is that a coffin will lead you to him. / The nerve of those little hooligans, stealing my work! / Those three must be working for Oogie Boogie. They’re probably at Oogie Boogie’s place right now. / You’ve got to get my heart back before Oogie Boogie ruins it! / Oogie Boogie must be in his manor. Go quickly and recover the heart! / My artificial heart should have been a huge success, but it was a huge failure! I can’t figure out what went wrong. / Maybe I used the wrong ingredient for “terror”? I’ll try a skull, or an actual Heartless next time. / Hmm… Perhaps I need to perfect terror first.

Jack is still talking about the Heartless Halloween. He still seems set on doing it. / The doctor’s still researching the heart. / Jack’s happiest when he’s planning the festival. And when he’s happy, I’m happy.
Hi, Sora. Care to join me for a stroll around Halloween Town? / What should we do for next year’s festival? If you have any good ideas, let me know! / I’ve got to make next Halloween a big success.
Sure. / Maybe next time.
Great! Let’s go, then.
The Heartless are completely out of control. The festival will be ruined! / Please get rid of them for us!
Let’s check this place, too, once the Heartless here are out of the way.
I have a bad feeling about this. If only Jack would reconsider…  I’m happy if he’s happy, but I’m just so worried about him. I’m worried about him because I… well, I just am.
Yes. This is it. Now, just one more ingredient. We need “surprise” to complete the heart. The mayor should know where it is.

Ghosts rise from those tombstones. Check the tombstones in the order the ghosts appear. If you get it wrong, you’re in for a surprise! / Check the tombstones. / Splendid! Now go look at the pumpkin. / Well? That was some surprise, eh? / I hope the heart’s finished in time for the festival.
Shut tight.
Is this a lantern? Try lighting it.
No knob, no keyhole. There must be a device somewhere to open it.
We were just following orders! Oogie Boogie told us to steal the heart. It’s all Barrel’s fault! It was his idea to tell Oogie Boogie about the heart.
Yeah, that’s right!
B-But you guys said–
You should be ashamed!
Hey, I was just following orders! / We don’t have the heart! Oogie Boogie has it! / You’ll never find the green door!
Oogie Boogie made us do it. We had no choice. / There’s no way I’m gonna take you to him! If I did that, Oogie Boogie would eat us, too.

Oogie Boogie told us not to give away his hiding place. Oh, and we’re not supposed to talk about the lever, either. / What’s he going to do with the heart? Beats me. / I’d stay away from Oogie Boogie if I were you.
Oogie Boogie, give me back the heart!
So, that heart was a failure after all.
Whoa! How did he get so big?
Look! It’s brimming with the power of darkness! Oogie Boogie is drawing power from those dark globs!
So we just have to destroy those things, right?
I guess we have no choice. We’ll have to cancel the Heartless Halloween festival for now. Here, I want you to have this. Visit us any time, Sora. Next year’s Halloween will be the scariest ever!
Emotion, memory… We put in all the necessary ingredients. What else do you need to make a heart? What is a heart, anyway? I can’t figure it out.

You’d better keep an eye on those three rascals. They may pull a prank the second you look away. / Jack’s already planning for next year’s festival! Please join us next Halloween. / The doctor’s still trying to make a heart.
Halloween Town’s quiet with Oogie Boogie gone. So we’re gonna shake it up. Quiet is boring! / We promise to be good, at least while you’re here. We’ve learned our lesson. Trust us.
I’m not doing anything bad… Not now, anyway. I’m keeping an eye on Lock and Barrel.
Actually, I don’t like pulling pranks. But I don’t wanna be left out, either. / It’s not fair. I get blamed for everything they do.
Uh, a big ship is catching up to us.
Quit gawking! That’s a pirate ship!
It’s going to ram us! Hold tight!
You’re all going down!

You’ll find her, Sora. Just don’t give up. / Thanks to Big Ben, you can tell the time from anywhere in London. But one of the clocks is off. I do hope it doesn’t confuse too many people. / Would you try striking the hands? That may fix it. / Something is shining on the roof. I wonder what it could be…  / Peter remains with me as long as I remember him. / You will find Kairi if she remains in your heart.
I can’t understand her.
I’ll bet Peter knows what she’s saying.
What is it, Tink? You want to go to the clock tower? It’s up to you, Sora.
Let’s go! / Not right now.
Okay! Let’s fly together! / Don’t be mad, Tink. Sora’s got a lot to do.
Well, we found the Navi-Gummi piece. Let’s go back to town.
Cid’ll install it on the ship once we bring it to him.
Show me what you’ve got!
Hercules, wait! Let’s go one-on-one!
Oh, brother. What a show-off.
What’re we gonna do?
Let him go alone, I guess.
Good luck, Sora!
I’m not gonna go easy on you!
Return to the outside world?
Let’s go. / Not yet.
An empty meadow. Take a look?
An odd sign hangs above this house’s door. Take a look?
A tall curious tree buzzing with bees. Take a look?
A broad expanse of vegetable fields. Take a look?
A swing hangs from a stout tree. Take a look?
A clearing crowded with tree stumps. Take a look?
A winding, muddy path. Take a look?
Sure. / Maybe later.
Let me guess

Have we met before? Welcome to the Hundred Acre Wood! / You’ve been a great help, Sora. Thank you! You helped Pooh get honey from the bees. / You helped protect Rabbit’s carrots. / You helped find Eeyore’s lost tail. / You bounced along with Tigger and Roo. / And you found all of us when we were lost. / We can’t thank you enough. This is from all of us in the Hundred Acre Wood. You’re always welcome here.
Brrr! I think I spent too much time on the swing. / Thank you, Sora. This is nice and warm. You've helped us so much. This is just something to say thank you.
If you could only chase away those bees, I’m quite certain I could get a small morsel of honey. Would you help me get some honey?
Should I help Pooh get some honey? / Sure! / Maybe later.
Oh. Hello there, Owl.

Good day, Pooh. What are you doing? Using a balloon to get some honey? Splendid idea! Allow me to offer a few pointers. Ahem! Now, Pooh can get honey by floating up this tree with his balloon. The honey is inside the tree hollows, not the beehives you see here. There’s quite a lot of honey in these holes. If Pooh gets too close, the bees will come out to protect their honey. If they get to Pooh, they’ll pop his balloon. Lock onto the bees and swat them away. The more time Pooh has at each hollow, the more honey he can eat. There’s more honey higher up, too. If jumping from branch to branch proves difficult, try the Rush command. Rush can help you catch up to Pooh quickly. But it isn’t fully reliable. Good luck.
I’m rather tired. Time for a short nap. / Oh, perhaps I ate too much. I’ll just stretch a bit to make more room.

I hope we’ll be finding more honey together soon! –Pooh / Mind if I bounce around in Rabbit’s garden again? –Tigger / Swinging is so much fun. I’d like to fly even farther! –Pooh / Let's bounce with Tigger again real soon! --Roo / Please join our next game of hide-and-seek! --Pooh / Everyone had a good time with you. Even Owl! –Pooh
Nobody’s home! And I’m out of honey!
Hey, you look like you’re in a bouncin’ mood!
Sure am! / Not now!
Look, Rabbit’s house c-came back! But it looks like Rabbit isn’t home. Pooh’s been calling and calling, but the house says no one’s there.
Nobody’s home?
That’s right. Nobody!
Who is this person named Nobody? Nobody, have you seen Rabbit?
No! No Rabbit here! There’s no one here!
Hello, Rabbit!
Why, P-Pooh. What a pleasant surprise… Nice to see you, too, Piglet. And… Is this a new friend? P-Pooh, I’m sorry, but… I’m all out of honey at the moment.

Interactions.Title: Rabbit’s Room Dialogue

Interactions.Line: Sora, do you smell honey? / I’m so glad to have found both Rabbit and some honey. / Oh, help and bother. I’m stuck again. I came in through this hole, so it must have shrunk.
So, Rabbit came back, too. But someone’s still missing… Some places in the Hundred Acre Wood are gone, too! Oh, wh-what to do?

I’ve nothing to give Pooh! Don’t waste your time looking around! / Ohh… Out of honey again. / All this because he can’t stop liking honey so much! If Pooh doesn’t slim down, my house will stay plugged up forever! If only there were something we could do…  / When you’re ready to push him out, just talk to him. Just a little push should do. / Thank you so much.

Music: Just an Itty Bitty Too Much

Interactions.Line: H-Honey? Now, how did that get up there? Would you like some, Pooh? Don’t feel like you have to, of course.
Oh, thank you, Rabbit. I would like just a small smackeral. I’m quite hungry.
Um, Pooh Bear… You’re not eating the whole pot, are you? Once you start, there’s no stopping you, is there…
H-Help! Please help Pooh!
Oh, how will I eat honey if I’m stuck here? When it’s lunch time, perhaps you could bring me a honey jar.

No honey ‘til you’re unstuck! If Pooh doesn’t slim down, my house will stay plugged up forever! If only there were something we could do… Wait, I know! A bit of carrot top juice will do the trick! I have a carrot patch on the other side of the stream. Carrot top juice is just the ticket to slimming down a Pooh! Oh, no!
Tigger’s bouncing will ruin my vegetables! And if we don’t give Pooh some carrot top juice, he’ll be stuck forever. Please help me! Keep Tigger away from my carrots!

This is quite a fix. But I have just the solution. Pay attention, now. Sora, you’ll have to protect this carrot patch. If Tigger bounces on a carrot twice, it’ll be buried. Once… Twice! Just like that. Protect the carrots from Tigger’s bounces and you’ll receive points. How, you ask? It’s elementary! Simply get to the carrots before Tigger lands on them. There are fifteen carrots here. Your score depends on how many you save, and how many times you block Tigger. Oh, and one more thing. The Rush command is the key to a high score. Select Rush while near a carrot that isn’t buried yet. You’ll dash to the target area before Tigger lands. Well, good luck!

Thank you so much. Now I’d better make that carrot top juice. I’ll get the carrots, so please wait inside the house. Oh, what a day! I gave Pooh the carrot top juice. All we have to do now is push him out. Just a little push should do. First my vegetable patch and now this…
Look, Pooh. Something is floating this way.
I think you’re right, Piglet. What could it be? Why, it looks like Eeyore! Hello, Eeyore, if it is you.
Hello, Pooh. Yes, it’s me. Could you pull me out? That is, if it’s not too much trouble. Of course, you don’t have to if you don’t want to.
Thank you, Pooh. Thank you, other you. You know, floating along out there, it seemed like something was missing… And something’s still missing.
Why, Eeyore’s tail is gone!

Is that what’s missing? Let’s see… Yep, lost it again. Wonder where it went this time. It’s not much of a tail, though I’m sort of attached to it. But I don’t know why anybody’d look for it. Probably won’t find it anyway…
Sora, why don’t we all look for Eeyore’s tail?
Lost something? Searching from a high place is the quickest way to find it!
Owl, can you fly up high and help us find Eeyore's tail?

Sorry, but my eyes aren't what they used to be. Too much reading, you know. But I can offer good advice! Of course, you don't have to if you don't want to. See that swing up there? Take Pooh there. You're a bit too big for the swing, but Pooh should fit nicely. I'll tell you more when you get there.
Here's what to do. First, get ready to push.
How?
Like this.
Like this?
Then press [button prompt] to give Pooh a push. Press [button prompt.]
How's this?

Not bad, not bad! Here's the next step. Press [button prompt] before he swings back to the bottom. If you time it right, Pooh will swing higher and higher. Try it! I'll help you with the timing. Press [button prompt] when I spread my wings. Push too soon, Pooh won't go any higher. Push too late, he'll go too high.
Oh, hello! Thanks again for your help with my carrots. / Let's all look very hard, to help our friend Eeyore.
Eeyore’s drifting away! Sora, can you swim?
Where in the Wood did that bouncin’ spot bounce off to? / My bouncin’ spot got lost, just like Eeyore’s tail.
Pooh will follow you if you target him with [button prompt.] / Careful, now. Eeyore’s counting on us to find that tail! Give Pooh honey to pep him up. / If Pooh gets tired, give him honey.
I'd better build my house where Pooh won't land on it…  / I think Pooh wants to swing…
I’ll go push him. / Maybe later.
I wonder what we can do? / Perhaps I’ll have to fly farther to find Eeyore’s tail. / I think I flew too far. Let’s try again! / Let’s play on the swing!
Okay! / Sure! / Maybe later.
Hm? That looks familiar...
How's it looking?
There we go.
It's not much of a tail, but it's mine. Thanks, everyone.
I wish we could put the Hundred Acre Wood back the way it was, too!
This here is my bouncin spot! We can bounce around here all day!
Nothing beats bouncin'!
You wanna bounce too, Sora? It's lotsa fun!
Lotsa fun!
Okay! / Maybe later.
To bounce with the finest, you'll need some pointers from the finest.
But, Owl, you don't bounce around like we do.
I'm afraid you're right. I can't master everything, I suppose.
Bounce this way, please!
Here's a little warm-up. Now it gets tricky. You're doing fantastical! This'll be the last one. You've gotten mighty good at bouncin', Sora! Right, Roo?
Hey, Tigger! I think he's ready for the big one!
Well, there's only one way to find out!
I wonder what this is.
This tree doesn’t have honey, I see.

Rare nuts grow on these trees. I’ll trade you things for them. / Ah, splendid! Here’s something in return. / Would you be so kind as to collect a few more nuts for me? / Look at all these nuts! We couldn’t have done it without you. / What are they for? It’s a secret.
Nothing beats bouncin’! / Aw, you couldn’t do it? Try again, okay? / Wow, Sora, you’re so good at everything!
Let’s go try the seesaw!
What are you doing, Pooh?
Shh. Quiet, or they’ll get away!
Who?

The people who took everyone away. See their footprints? We were all sticking together to make sure no one got lost again. But then, I saw some footprints that needed following. So I did. Suddenly, everyone was gone. Bad people must have taken them away!
Actually, Pooh, I think those footprints are… Um… Anyway, I’ll help you look for your friends.
Eeyore?
Hello.
What are you doing?
Lookin’ for sticks to build my house… again.
Sticks for your house? This place already feels like a house… Seems like a great spot to gather everyone once we find them.
I tried bouncin’ as high as Tigger. I was so busy tryin’ to bounce, I forgot to watch where I was bouncin’!
Owl looked so intent on something, well, I just had to follow him! But then Owl flew off into the sky, and there I was, all by myself.
I saw Pooh walkin’ away, so I bounced after him! Then I bounced a bit too high, and I lost sight of ol’ Pooh Bear!
I thought I’d better have a word with Roo about his bouncing. The next thing I knew, quite to my surprise, I was lost, too!
Hello, Piglet.
Pooh! Where are we?
I don’t know where we are either, Piglet. But if we go back the way we came, we should find home.
I got scared when everyone disappeared, so I hid.
Everyone’s here!
I wonder how quickly we can find everyone.
Let’s find out! / No idea.

Interactions.Title: The Navigation Gummis for Hollow Bastion

Interactions.Line: Looks like you found the other one. Let me see it. Okay, wait here. I’ll get it installed right now. I installed that navigation gummi. But, ya know? That place is crawling with Heartless. Don’t say I didn’t warn you.
Here, take this along.
Gawrsh, look at that!
I know this place…
Hmm, that’s strange.
I wonder why… I feel this warmth inside, right here.
Aw, you’re just hungry.
Hey, I’m serious! Let’s go!
No response.
To upper level. / To lower level.
It sounds like a door has opened. Head back to the castle gates. / No response.
Need the Beast’s help.
There are four sockets. What goes in them? / One stone is in place. Three sockets left. / Two stones are in place. Two sockets left. / Three stones are in place. One socket left.
The candle is out. / The candle is burning.
O mighty one…  Show me your crushing power.
O mighty one…  Prove your strength by moving me.
The stone is etched with a thunderbolt.

The books seem to be arranged alphabetically. This is the A/H/K/M/N/S/T shelf. / Put Azal vol. 3/Hafet vol. 4/Khama vol. 8/Mava vol. 3/Mava vol. 6/Nahara vol. 5/Salegg vol. 6/Theon vol. 6 on the shelf. / There is a book missing. / Something is not right.
The door has been unlocked.
Sora, you should read this.
Read what?
